definition: light-years (apart)/a million miles (apart)/(i.e. indicates a huge difference or a huge distance)
the hundred thousands place (or column) in the decimal system

sentences.english: Qianshan is a new economic zone with a population of more than three hundred thousand.
sentences.chinese: 千山是一個新的經濟區，人口超過三十萬。

sentences.english: It comes to about eleven and a half million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 這樣大概是一千一百五十萬美元。

sentences.english: I was frantic to finish the report on schedule.
sentences.chinese: 我十萬火急地要按預定時間完成報告。
分析家預測銀行將裁員二十萬。

sentences.english: They have also bred 200,000 toxin-free fruit tree nurseries.
sentences.chinese: 他們還培育無毒果樹苗木二十萬株。

sentences.english: A month 300,000 targets I will make one effort to attain.
sentences.chinese: 一個月三十萬的目標我是會盡力去做到的。

sentences.english: The king of Zhao accpeted the gifts gladly and sent a hundred thousand troops to help Qi.
sentences.chinese: 趙王見了禮物十分高興，派了十萬士兵去援助齊國。

sentences.english: Guangwu deep appreciation and gratuities three hundred thousand.
sentences.chinese: 光武帝深表讚賞，又賞錢三十萬。

sentences.english: Ou tell father, Sue gave cutting line seven hundred thousand.
sentences.chinese: 伊歐告訴父親，蘇切給了朵索七十萬。

sentences.english: Now days there are tens of thousands paragliding fans all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 如今，在世界各地，飛行傘愛好者已達數十萬。

sentences.english: Yeah, there'll be somebody around 100,000 years from now, 500,000 years from now, and maybe they'll be me.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯十萬年後會有一個人，5萬年後，也許他們是我。

sentences.english: Four hundred thousand men worked for twenty years to build it.
sentences.chinese: 四十萬人花二十年時間才建成了這座金字塔。

sentences.english: But a weed plant can produce tens or even hundreds of thousands of seeds.
sentences.chinese: 但每株雜草能產生數萬甚至數十萬顆種子。

sentences.english: Sengoku warrior on horseback has been created from hundreds of thousands of rice plants.
sentences.chinese: 馬背上的戰國武士用水稻幾十萬棵。
年營業收入下降17%跌至5億7千零6十萬美元。

sentences.english: The Xiangride Prison Farm south of Dulan at one time had 100,000 prisoners.
sentences.chinese: 都蘭南部的香日德勞改營曾一度關有囚犯十萬人。

definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
